docs.title: rigid
docs.description: the output text file containing the rigid transformation as a 4x4 matrix

docs.title: rigid_1tomidway
docs.description: the output text file containing the rigid transformation that aligns image1 to image2 in their common midway space as a 4x4 matrix

docs.title: rigid_2tomidway
docs.description: the output text file containing the rigid transformation that aligns image2 to image1 in their common midway space as a 4x4 matrix

docs.title: rigid_log
docs.description: write gradient descent parameter evolution to log file

docs.title: affine
docs.description: the output text file containing the affine transformation as a 4x4 matrix

docs.title: affine_1tomidway
docs.description: the output text file containing the affine transformation that aligns image1 to image2 in their common midway space as a 4x4 matrix

docs.title: affine_2tomidway
docs.description: the output text file containing the affine transformation that aligns image2 to image1 in their common midway space as a 4x4 matrix

docs.title: affine_log
docs.description: write gradient descent parameter evolution to log file

docs.title: nl_warp_full
docs.description: output all warps used during registration. This saves four different warps that map each image to a midway space and their inverses in a single 5D image file. The 4th image dimension indexes the x,y,z component of the deformation vector and the 5th dimension indexes the field in this order: image1->midway, midway->image1, image2->midway, midway->image2. Where image1->midway defines the field that maps image1 onto the midway space using the reverse convention When linear registration is performed first, the estimated linear transform will be included in the comments of the image header, and therefore the entire linear and non-linear transform can be applied (in either direction) using this output warp file with mrtransform

docs.title: mrregister
docs.description:
Register two images together using a symmetric rigid, affine or non-linear transformation model.

By default this application will perform an affine, followed by non-linear registration.

FOD registration (with apodised point spread reorientation) will be performed by default if the number of volumes in the 4th dimension equals the number of coefficients in an antipodally symmetric spherical harmonic series (e.g. 6, 15, 28 etc). The -no_reorientation option can be used to force reorientation off if required.

Non-linear registration computes warps to map from both image1->image2 and image2->image1. Similar to Avants (2008) Med Image Anal. 12(1): 26â€“41, registration is performed by matching both the image1 and image2 in a 'midway space'. Warps can be saved as two deformation fields that map directly between image1->image2 and image2->image1, or if using -nl_warp_full as a single 5D file that stores all 4 warps image1->mid->image2, and image2->mid->image1. The 5D warp format stores x,y,z deformations in the 4th dimension, and uses the 5th dimension to index the 4 warps. The affine transforms estimated (to midway space) are also stored as comments in the image header. The 5D warp file can be used to reinitialise subsequent registrations, in addition to transforming images to midway space (e.g. for intra-subject alignment in a 2-time-point longitudinal analysis).

References:

* If FOD registration is being performed:
Raffelt, D.; Tournier, J.-D.; Fripp, J; Crozier, S.; Connelly, A. & Salvado, O. Symmetric diffeomorphic registration of fibre orientation distributions. NeuroImage, 2011, 56(3), 1171-1180

Raffelt, D.; Tournier, J.-D.; Crozier, S.; Connelly, A. & Salvado, O. Reorientation of fiber orientation distributions using apodized point spread functions. Magnetic Resonance in Medicine, 2012, 67, 844-855

docs.title: type
docs.description: the registration type. Valid choices are: rigid, affine, nonlinear, rigid_affine, rigid_nonlinear, affine_nonlinear, rigid_affine_nonlinear (Default: affine_nonlinear)

docs.title: image
docs.description: image1 after registration transformed and regridded to the space of image2. Note that -transformed needs to be repeated for each contrast if multi-contrast registration is used.

docs.title: transformed
docs.description: image1 after registration transformed and regridded to the space of image2. Note that -transformed needs to be repeated for each contrast if multi-contrast registration is used.

docs.title: image
docs.description: image1 after registration transformed and regridded to the space of image2. Note that -transformed needs to be repeated for each contrast if multi-contrast registration is used.

docs.title: transformed
docs.description: image1 after registration transformed and regridded to the space of image2. Note that -transformed needs to be repeated for each contrast if multi-contrast registration is used.

docs.title: image1_transformed
docs.description: image1 and image2 after registration transformed and regridded to the midway space. Note that -transformed_midway needs to be repeated for each contrast if multi-contrast registration is used.

docs.title: image2_transformed
docs.description: image1 and image2 after registration transformed and regridded to the midway space. Note that -transformed_midway needs to be repeated for each contrast if multi-contrast registration is used.

docs.title: transformed_midway
docs.description: image1 and image2 after registration transformed and regridded to the midway space. Note that -transformed_midway needs to be repeated for each contrast if multi-contrast registration is used.

docs.title: image1_transformed
docs.description: image1 and image2 after registration transformed and regridded to the midway space. Note that -transformed_midway needs to be repeated for each contrast if multi-contrast registration is used.

docs.title: image2_transformed
docs.description: image1 and image2 after registration transformed and regridded to the midway space. Note that -transformed_midway needs to be repeated for each contrast if multi-contrast registration is used.

docs.title: transformed_midway
docs.description: image1 and image2 after registration transformed and regridded to the midway space. Note that -transformed_midway needs to be repeated for each contrast if multi-contrast registration is used.

docs.title: mask1
docs.description: a mask to define the region of image1 to use for optimisation.

docs.title: mask2
docs.description: a mask to define the region of image2 to use for optimisation.

docs.title: nan
docs.description: use NaN as out of bounds value. (Default: 0.0)

docs.title: rigid
docs.description: the output text file containing the rigid transformation as a 4x4 matrix

docs.title: rigid_1tomidway
docs.description: the output text file containing the rigid transformation that aligns image1 to image2 in their common midway space as a 4x4 matrix

docs.title: rigid_2tomidway
docs.description: the output text file containing the rigid transformation that aligns image2 to image1 in their common midway space as a 4x4 matrix

docs.title: rigid_init_translation
docs.description:
initialise the translation and centre of rotation 
Valid choices are: 
mass (aligns the centers of mass of both images, default), 
geometric (aligns geometric image centres) and none.

docs.title: rigid_init_rotation
docs.description:
initialise the rotation Valid choices are: 
search (search for the best rotation using mean squared residuals), 
moments (rotation based on directions of intensity variance with respect to centre of mass), 
none (default).

docs.title: rigid_init_matrix
docs.description: initialise either the rigid, affine, or syn registration with the supplied rigid transformation (as a 4x4 matrix in scanner coordinates). Note that this overrides rigid_init_translation and rigid_init_rotation initialisation

docs.title: rigid_scale
docs.description: use a multi-resolution scheme by defining a scale factor for each level using comma separated values (Default: 0.25,0.5,1.0)

docs.title: rigid_niter
docs.description: the maximum number of gradient descent iterations per stage. This can be specified either as a single number for all multi-resolution levels, or a single value for each level. (Default: 1000)

docs.title: rigid_metric
docs.description: valid choices are: diff (intensity differences), Default: diff

docs.title: rigid_metric_diff_estimator
docs.description: Valid choices are: l1 (least absolute: |x|), l2 (ordinary least squares), lp (least powers: |x|^1.2), Default: l2

docs.title: rigid_lmax
docs.description: explicitly set the lmax to be used per scale factor in rigid FOD registration. By default FOD registration will use lmax 0,2,4 with default scale factors 0.25,0.5,1.0 respectively. Note that no reorientation will be performed with lmax = 0.

docs.title: rigid_log
docs.description: write gradient descent parameter evolution to log file

docs.title: affine
docs.description: the output text file containing the affine transformation as a 4x4 matrix

docs.title: affine_1tomidway
docs.description: the output text file containing the affine transformation that aligns image1 to image2 in their common midway space as a 4x4 matrix

docs.title: affine_2tomidway
docs.description: the output text file containing the affine transformation that aligns image2 to image1 in their common midway space as a 4x4 matrix

docs.title: affine_init_translation
docs.description:
initialise the translation and centre of rotation 
Valid choices are: 
mass (aligns the centers of mass of both images), 
geometric (aligns geometric image centres) and none. (Default: mass)

docs.title: affine_init_rotation
docs.description:
initialise the rotation Valid choices are: 
search (search for the best rotation using mean squared residuals), 
moments (rotation based on directions of intensity variance with respect to centre of mass), 
none (Default: none).

docs.title: affine_init_matrix
docs.description: initialise either the affine, or syn registration with the supplied affine transformation (as a 4x4 matrix in scanner coordinates). Note that this overrides affine_init_translation and affine_init_rotation initialisation

docs.title: affine_scale
docs.description: use a multi-resolution scheme by defining a scale factor for each level using comma separated values (Default: 0.25,0.5,1.0)

docs.title: affine_niter
docs.description: the maximum number of gradient descent iterations per stage. This can be specified either as a single number for all multi-resolution levels, or a single value for each level. (Default: 1000)

docs.title: affine_metric
docs.description: valid choices are: diff (intensity differences), Default: diff

docs.title: affine_metric_diff_estimator
docs.description: Valid choices are: l1 (least absolute: |x|), l2 (ordinary least squares), lp (least powers: |x|^1.2), Default: l2

docs.title: affine_lmax
docs.description: explicitly set the lmax to be used per scale factor in affine FOD registration. By default FOD registration will use lmax 0,2,4 with default scale factors 0.25,0.5,1.0 respectively. Note that no reorientation will be performed with lmax = 0.

docs.title: affine_log
docs.description: write gradient descent parameter evolution to log file

docs.title: init_translation_unmasked1
docs.description: disregard mask1 for the translation initialisation (affects 'mass')

docs.title: init_translation_unmasked2
docs.description: disregard mask2 for the translation initialisation (affects 'mass')

docs.title: init_rotation_unmasked1
docs.description: disregard mask1 for the rotation initialisation (affects 'search' and 'moments')

docs.title: init_rotation_unmasked2
docs.description: disregard mask2 for the rotation initialisation (affects 'search' and 'moments')

docs.title: init_rotation_search_angles
docs.description: rotation angles for the local search in degrees between 0 and 180. (Default: 2,5,10,15,20)

docs.title: init_rotation_search_scale
docs.description: relative size of the images used for the rotation search. (Default: 0.15)

docs.title: init_rotation_search_directions
docs.description: number of rotation axis for local search. (Default: 250)

docs.title: init_rotation_search_run_global
docs.description: perform a global search. (Default: local)

docs.title: init_rotation_search_global_iterations
docs.description: number of rotations to investigate (Default: 10000)

docs.title: linstage_iterations
docs.description: number of iterations for each registration stage, not to be confused with -rigid_niter or -affine_niter. This can be used to generate intermediate diagnostics images (-linstage.diagnostics.prefix) or to change the cost function optimiser during registration (without the need to repeatedly resize the images). (Default: 1 == no repetition)

docs.title: linstage_optimiser_first
docs.description: Cost function optimisation algorithm to use at first iteration of all stages. Valid choices: bbgd (Barzilai-Borwein gradient descent) or gd (simple gradient descent). (Default: bbgd)

docs.title: linstage_optimiser_last
docs.description: Cost function optimisation algorithm to use at last iteration of all stages (if there are more than one). Valid choices: bbgd (Barzilai-Borwein gradient descent) or gd (simple gradient descent). (Default: bbgd)

docs.title: linstage_optimiser_default
docs.description: Cost function optimisation algorithm to use at any stage iteration other than first or last iteration. Valid choices: bbgd (Barzilai-Borwein gradient descent) or gd (simple gradient descent). (Default: bbgd)

docs.title: linstage_diagnostics_prefix
docs.description: generate diagnostics images after every registration stage

docs.title: warp1
docs.description: the non-linear warp output defined as two deformation fields, where warp1 can be used to transform image1->image2 and warp2 to transform image2->image1. The deformation fields also encapsulate any linear transformation estimated prior to non-linear registration.

docs.title: warp2
docs.description: the non-linear warp output defined as two deformation fields, where warp1 can be used to transform image1->image2 and warp2 to transform image2->image1. The deformation fields also encapsulate any linear transformation estimated prior to non-linear registration.

docs.title: nl_warp
docs.description: the non-linear warp output defined as two deformation fields, where warp1 can be used to transform image1->image2 and warp2 to transform image2->image1. The deformation fields also encapsulate any linear transformation estimated prior to non-linear registration.

docs.title: warp1
docs.description: the non-linear warp output defined as two deformation fields, where warp1 can be used to transform image1->image2 and warp2 to transform image2->image1. The deformation fields also encapsulate any linear transformation estimated prior to non-linear registration.

docs.title: warp2
docs.description: the non-linear warp output defined as two deformation fields, where warp1 can be used to transform image1->image2 and warp2 to transform image2->image1. The deformation fields also encapsulate any linear transformation estimated prior to non-linear registration.

docs.title: nl_warp
docs.description: the non-linear warp output defined as two deformation fields, where warp1 can be used to transform image1->image2 and warp2 to transform image2->image1. The deformation fields also encapsulate any linear transformation estimated prior to non-linear registration.

docs.title: nl_warp_full
docs.description: output all warps used during registration. This saves four different warps that map each image to a midway space and their inverses in a single 5D image file. The 4th image dimension indexes the x,y,z component of the deformation vector and the 5th dimension indexes the field in this order: image1->midway, midway->image1, image2->midway, midway->image2. Where image1->midway defines the field that maps image1 onto the midway space using the reverse convention When linear registration is performed first, the estimated linear transform will be included in the comments of the image header, and therefore the entire linear and non-linear transform can be applied (in either direction) using this output warp file with mrtransform

docs.title: nl_init
docs.description: initialise the non-linear registration with the supplied warp image. The supplied warp must be in the same format as output using the -nl_warp_full option (i.e. have 4 deformation fields with the linear transforms in the image header)

docs.title: nl_scale
docs.description: use a multi-resolution scheme by defining a scale factor for each level using comma separated values (Default: 0.25,0.5,1.0)

docs.title: nl_niter
docs.description: the maximum number of iterations. This can be specified either as a single number for all multi-resolution levels, or a single value for each level. (Default: 50)

docs.title: nl_update_smooth
docs.description: regularise the gradient update field with Gaussian smoothing (standard deviation in voxel units, Default 2.0)

docs.title: nl_disp_smooth
docs.description: regularise the displacement field with Gaussian smoothing (standard deviation in voxel units, Default 1.0)

docs.title: nl_grad_step
docs.description: the gradient step size for non-linear registration (Default: 0.5)

docs.title: nl_lmax
docs.description: explicitly set the lmax to be used per scale factor in non-linear FOD registration. By default FOD registration will use lmax 0,2,4 with default scale factors 0.25,0.5,1.0 respectively. Note that no reorientation will be performed with lmax = 0.

docs.title: diagnostics_image
docs.description: write intermediate images for diagnostics purposes

docs.title: directions
docs.description: the directions used for FOD reorientation using apodised point spread functions (Default: 60 directions)

docs.title: noreorientation
docs.description: turn off FOD reorientation. Reorientation is on by default if the number of volumes in the 4th dimension corresponds to the number of coefficients in an antipodally symmetric spherical harmonic series (i.e. 6, 15, 28, 45, 66 etc)

docs.title: mc_weights
docs.description: relative weight of images used for multi-contrast registration. Default: 1.0 (equal weighting)

docs.title: datatype
docs.description: specify output image data type. Valid choices are: float32, float32le, float32be, float64, float64le, float64be, int64, uint64, int64le, uint64le, int64be, uint64be, int32, uint32, int32le, uint32le, int32be, uint32be, int16, uint16, int16le, uint16le, int16be, uint16be, cfloat32, cfloat32le, cfloat32be, cfloat64, cfloat64le, cfloat64be, int8, uint8, bit.

docs.title: info
docs.description: display information messages.

docs.title: quiet
docs.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

docs.title: debug
docs.description: display debugging messages.

docs.title: force
docs.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

docs.title: nthreads
docs.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).

docs.title: config
docs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

docs.title: key
docs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

docs.title: value
docs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

docs.title: config
docs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

docs.title: help
docs.description: display this information page and exit.

docs.title: version
docs.description: display version information and exit.

docs.title: image1_image2
docs.description: input image 1 ('moving') and input image 2 ('template')

docs.title: contrast1_contrast2
docs.description: optional list of additional input images used as additional contrasts. Can be used multiple times. contrastX and imageX must share the same coordinate system.

docs.title: mrregister
docs.description:
Register two images together using a symmetric rigid, affine or non-linear transformation model.

By default this application will perform an affine, followed by non-linear registration.

FOD registration (with apodised point spread reorientation) will be performed by default if the number of volumes in the 4th dimension equals the number of coefficients in an antipodally symmetric spherical harmonic series (e.g. 6, 15, 28 etc). The -no_reorientation option can be used to force reorientation off if required.

Non-linear registration computes warps to map from both image1->image2 and image2->image1. Similar to Avants (2008) Med Image Anal. 12(1): 26â€“41, registration is performed by matching both the image1 and image2 in a 'midway space'. Warps can be saved as two deformation fields that map directly between image1->image2 and image2->image1, or if using -nl_warp_full as a single 5D file that stores all 4 warps image1->mid->image2, and image2->mid->image1. The 5D warp format stores x,y,z deformations in the 4th dimension, and uses the 5th dimension to index the 4 warps. The affine transforms estimated (to midway space) are also stored as comments in the image header. The 5D warp file can be used to reinitialise subsequent registrations, in addition to transforming images to midway space (e.g. for intra-subject alignment in a 2-time-point longitudinal analysis).

References:

* If FOD registration is being performed:
Raffelt, D.; Tournier, J.-D.; Fripp, J; Crozier, S.; Connelly, A. & Salvado, O. Symmetric diffeomorphic registration of fibre orientation distributions. NeuroImage, 2011, 56(3), 1171-1180

Raffelt, D.; Tournier, J.-D.; Crozier, S.; Connelly, A. & Salvado, O. Reorientation of fiber orientation distributions using apodized point spread functions. Magnetic Resonance in Medicine, 2012, 67, 844-855
